meanings.definition: To send as a representative or ambassador.
meanings.sent1: The president decided to ablegate his trusted advisor to negotiate with the foreign leaders.
meanings.sent2: The company will ablegate a team of experts to attend the international conference.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to ablegate its owner to open the door for it.
meanings.sent4: The sun ablegates its rays to warm the earth each day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher ablegates the responsibility of leading the class discussion to the students.

meanings.definition: A person sent as a representative or ambassador.
meanings.sent1: The ablegate from the neighboring country arrived to discuss the peace treaty.
meanings.sent2: The ablegate presented the royal decree to the council members.
meanings.sent3: The ablegate accidentally took the wrong path and ended up in a comedy show.
meanings.sent4: The ablegate stood tall like a beacon of diplomacy in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The ablegate's attire reflected the traditions of their homeland.
